item.title: Agony of the Cell Phone Shopper
item.description: Shopping for cell phones the traditional way can be a real pain. Spending hours at carrier stores, dealing with pushy salespeople, and then finding yourself empty-handed and frustrated is not a fun experience. A study by J.D. Power and Associates confirms that dissatisfaction is common, with sales staff, store displays, store facilities, and pricing being the main culprits. And let’s not forget about gas prices! Driving around from store to store in search of the perfect phone can drain your wallet as fast as it drains your patience.

item.title: Times Are Tough, Cell Phones Are Free
item.description: With the current economic climate, most people are looking for ways to save money. Instead of spending lavishly, it’s wiser to be cautious and prepare for potential tough times ahead. One way to save money is by finding deals on essential items like cell phone services and devices. Many people purchase their cell phones from carrier stores or large retailers, but these places often charge a premium for the phones themselves.
